channel.title: Help client
channel.description:
So i ran the client it goes to the log in screen. It was on a different ip and i connected to it then i switched it to my ip that i made from no-ip.com and tried connecting and it didn't work. Do i need to portforward even though i am using my computer? And how would i set this server up on a vps and do i still need to portforward? I don't understand what do i portforward my own ip or the ip i got from no-ip.
thanks

item.title: Help client
item.dc:creator: @Fierystr Fierystr
item.description:
@Fierystr wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:2, topic:393909”][quote author=Fierystr link=topic=491093.msg3591076#msg3591076 date=1304639938]
So i ran the client it goes to the log in screen. It was on a different ip and i connected to it then i switched it to my ip that i made from no-ip.com and tried connecting and it didn’t work. Do i need to portforward even though i am using my computer? And how would i set this server up on a vps and do i still need to portforward? I don’t understand what do i portforward my own ip or the ip i got from no-ip.

thanks
[/quote]Yes you must port if you use your computer. After you have ported via your router and firewall you can use canyouseem.org to help see if the port is open.[/quote]

i portforwarded but it’s not working i get this error on canyouseeme

Error: I could not see your service on IP ADDRESS on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused

i have no idea why i think i portforwarded it correctly

Read full topic

item.title: Help client
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Fierystr, post:1, topic:393909”]So i ran the client it goes to the log in screen. It was on a different ip and i connected to it then i switched it to my ip that i made from no-ip.com and tried connecting and it didn’t work. Do i need to portforward even though i am using my computer? And how would i set this server up on a vps and do i still need to portforward? I don’t understand what do i portforward my own ip or the ip i got from no-ip.

thanks[/quote]Yes you must port if you use your computer. After you have ported via your router and firewall you can use canyouseem.org to help see if the port is open.

Read full topic
